author: paulhauner
content: I'm seeing a total of `3169` deposits where `103` of those deposits have an invalid signature.

author: paulhauner
content: Sigma Prime has 1024 deposits that start somewhere around index #1040. They were submitted in batches of 256 and I think some other deposits are interleaved between ours (i.e., we don't have a contiguous range).

author: paulhauner
content: We have two boot nodes running, their ENR are here: https://github.com/goerli/medalla/pull/30

author: torfbolt
content: Is Launchpad already working for Medalla? Will it have more safeguards against invalid deposits than e.g. ethdo?

author: djrtwo
content: Will be released Monday and yes it checks everything that is generated via a cli on the web interface before sending deposits

author: jgm
content: Note that ethereal has a fair number of checks, including the ability to multiple deposits to the same validator public key

author: djrtwo
content: Yeah, to be clear, just making claims about the checks in the web interface. Not sure how it compares to other tools

author: jgm
content: Just wanted to point that out, because I think it's cool ðŸ˜„

author: djrtwo
content: Have has fun playing with ethdo and ethereal recently!

author: jgm
content: Various foundational work on-going for other reasons, but I'm hoping to have an abstraction layer for beacon nodes released in the next week or so.  That will allow ethdo to talk to lighthouse as well as prysm, with additional clients to come after.

author: jgm
content: (Actually that reminds me: I forgot to announce it but there is a subgraph up for the eth2 dpeosit contract for medalla at https://thegraph.com/explorer/subgraph/attestantio/eth2deposits-medalla )
